intro: Strakaea, commonly known as the yellow mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of trees and shrubs. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its berries are orange-red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Strakaea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
